conbody.p: The Eucalyptus CLC has a Domain Name System (DNS) service built into it that responds to DNS requests in order to support virtual hosting of buckets (mapping bucket names to IP addresses) and instance DNS (mapping of hostnames to instance public and private IP addresses).
By default, Eucalyptus attempts to run DNS. If you don't want Eucalyptus to run DNS what???
On the CLC, make sure no other services is running on port 53, the standard DNS port. If there is another service running on 53, Eucalyptus will not fail. However, it won't run DNS.
conbody.note: Whenever possible, we recommend that you use domain names instead of IP addresses in your Eucalyptus configuration.
